data.title: Water temperature in Yekaterinburg in the Iset River now
data.meta_description: What is the current water temperature in Yekaterinburg in the Iset River? How the water temperature will change in Yekaterinburg in the coming days. Statistics for recent years.
data.text:
Russia > Sverdlovsk region

Yekaterinburg

Water temperature in the Iset River today

Yekaterinburg, Russia | © ural.kp.ru

The most detailed information about the water temperature in Yekaterinburg in the Iset River (Sverdlovsk region, Russia). Forecast of changes in water temperature for the next 10 days. Statistics by months for recent years. Information about the neighboring resorts. Weather forecast in Yekaterinburg for a week.

Water temperature in Yekaterinburg right now

data updated 27 minutes ago

16.6°C

yesterday: 16.8°C

a week ago: 16.1°C

Trend: slow drop

Today water temperature in Yekaterinburg is 16.6°C. This is cool bathing water, but acceptable for short dives for physically fit and hardened people. Continuous exposure to such water for more than four hours can lead to severe hypothermia. In any case, the general weather is also important. So, the air temperature at the same time will reach 11°C.

Analysis and forecast

The water temperature today is slightly lower than the average on this day in recent years. Its value has rise both over the past 20 days and over the past week. Exactly a year ago, on this day, the water temperature in this location was 19°C. Water temperature range in Yekaterinburg in August is from 11 to 25 degrees.

According to our forecast, in the coming days, the water temperature value in Yekaterinburg will slightly drop and in 10 days it will be 14.9°C.

* Fact - Actual value of water temperature

** Average - Average water temperature on this day in past years

*** Forecast - Our forecast for the water temperature

Actual nearshore temperatures may vary by several degrees from the indicated values. This is noticeable after heavy rain or after prolonged periods of strong winds. Some downstream winds cause cold, deep waters to replace surface waters that have been warmed by the sun.

To develop a forecast, we use our own mathematical model, which takes into account the current change in water temperature, historical data and the main weather trends, wind strength and direction, air temperature in each specific region. We also take into account data for other resorts in Russia.

Yekaterinburg, Russia | © rutraveller.ru

Annual graph of average water temperature change in Yekaterinburg

Water temperature in Yekaterinburg by month

Yekaterinburg located in the northern hemisphere, at latitude 56 degrees. The comfortable water temperature for swimming is set here in July, usually at the beginning of the month. During a year in Yekaterinburg there are 20 days of swimming. In general, the swimming season ends in July. Average annual water temperature on the coast in Yekaterinburg is 8.6°C, by the seasons: in winter 3.0°C, in spring 7.0°C, in summer 17.0°C, in autumn 7.3°C. Minimum water temperature (2.8°C) in Yekaterinburg it happens in February, maximum (23.5°C) in July.

You can find out detailed data on how the water temperature in Yekaterinburg changes in each specific month:

The warmest water today in Russia recorded in Agoy, its value is 27.5°C. Lowest - in Mys Kamennyy, there water temperature now 2.1°C. Average water temperature in the country today - 19.7°C.

Water temperature data in Yekaterinburg and neighboring towns and resorts collected from various sources, using buoys, using satellite maps of sea, river and lake surfaces of the NOAA agency.

We use data from various local authorities in each specific location of the world to more accurately reflect temperature values.

The nearest airport is located in a 14 kilometers. This is Koltsovo (SVX) airport. We have no information as to whether it is valid and what flights it receives or sends.

Find out the temperature of sea water in more than 12000 cities and resorts around the world. Water surface temperature values are available in real time. There is a forecast of water temperature changes for the next few days, as well as historical data of sea surface temperature are available for all days of the last years.

We use data from various sources, including National Centers for Environmental Information (NOAA), meteorological services of different countries, data received from more than a thousand buoys around the world, satellite systems for scanning the surface of the oceans and seas.
